result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Kone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Report to Jail, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay an DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect. Sentencing 5/16/16 at 3:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. File will continue to track 14-CF-157. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference at 02-08-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to set 14-CF-157 for pretrial and trial, asks that this file continue to track 2014 file.  Court will set status in this file for the same day as pretrial in 14-CF-157. Bond remains in effect.
Assuming the Information mirrors the criminal complaint, Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file the Information later today.

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicates defendant ready to waive his right to the preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court indicates Atty Reetz unable to attend hearing today as he had to be in court in Brown County. Court questions defendant on address/employment. State requests signature bond as defendant will be serving a sentence. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Christopher J Kone not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court indicates defendant was to be in court today for file 14-CF-157, no appearance by defendant. Atty Clowers indicates his office sent notice of todays court date, hasn't had any contact with defendant since last hearing. Court realizes defendant doesn't have notice of new charges but was he was aware of todays court date in file 14-CF-157. State requests bench warrant.  Court orders bench warrant.
